subject: Re: [junit] JUnit will not run on JDeveloper
msgSnippet: ... So give it one: public static void main(String[] args) { junit.textui.TestRunner.run(MoneyTester1.class); } Dave -- Dave Astels (dave@saorsa.com) Coauthor
messageBody:
On Fri, 2002-11-08 at 09:41, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Hint: You don't run your test class, you run a test runner.
>
> So said viet5459 on 2002-11-07

> >The target MoneyTester1.java cannot be started as an application,
> >because the class MoneyTester1 does not have a main method.

So give it one:

public static void main(String[] args) {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(MoneyTester1.class);
}

Dave
--
Dave Astels (dave@...)
Coauthor of "A Practical Guide to eXtreme Programming"
Author of "A Practical Guide to Test-driven Development"
Editor of the TDD Edition of The Coad Letter (www.thecoadletter.com)
CEO & Master Software Craftsman, Saorsa Development Inc.
www.saorsa.com
"An Agile Software Studio"
